Info.Description: Sharpens the image by enhancing the contrast of edges. Despite its name, the unsharp mask is commonly used for sharpening; it works by subtracting a blurred (or 'unsharp') version of the image from the original image to create the illusion of sharper edges.

Properties.Name: Amount
Properties.Summary: Adjusts the intensity of the sharpening effect. Higher values make the details more pronounced, while lower values apply a subtler sharpening effect.

Properties.Name: Radius
Properties.Summary: Determines the size of the area around each pixel that the filter considers when applying the sharpening effect. A larger radius results in a more pronounced effect on larger details, while a smaller radius sharpens finer details.

Properties.Name: Threshold
Properties.Summary:
Controls the minimum brightness change that will be sharpened. This means that low-contrast edge detail can be excluded from the sharpening process, preventing noise from being accentuated.
A higher threshold value excludes more areas from the sharpening effect, while a lower value allows more areas to be sharpened.
